intro: Eleutheranthera areolata, commonly known as the spotted rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its most distinctive feature is the spotted, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Eleutheranthera areolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
